verses.text: A labouring man \add that is\add* given to drunkenness shall not be rich: And he that contemneth small \add things\add* shall fall by little and little.
Wine and women will make men of understanding to fall away: And he that cleaveth to harlots will become impudent.
Moths and worms shall have him to heritage, And a bold man shall be taken away.
He that is hasty to give credit \add is\add* lightminded; And he that sinneth shall offend against his own soul.
Whoso taketh pleasure in wickedness shall be condemned: But he that resisteth pleasures crowneth his life.
He that can rule \add his\add* tongue shall live without strife; And he that hateth babbling shall have less evil.
Rehearse not unto another that which is told unto thee, And thou shalt fare never the worse.
Whether it be to friend or foe, talk not of other men’s lives; And if thou canst without offence, reveal \add them\add* not.
For he heard and observed thee, And when time cometh he will hate thee.
\add If\add* thou hast heard a word, let it die with thee; And be bold, it will not burst thee.
A fool travaileth with a word, As a \add woman\add* in labour of a child.
\add As\add* an arrow that sticketh in a man’s thigh, So \add is\add* a word within a fool’s belly.
Admonish a friend, it may be he hath not done \add it:\add* And if he have done \add it\add*, that he do \add it\add* no more.
Admonish \add thy\add* friend, it may be he hath not said \add it:\add* And if he have, that he speak \add it\add* not again.
Admonish a friend: for many times it is a slander, And believe not every tale.
There is one that slippeth in \add his\add* speech, but not from \add his\add* heart; And who is he that hath not offended with his tongue?
Admonish thy neighbour before \add thou\add* threaten \add him;\add* And not being angry, give place to the law of the most High.
The fear of the Lord \add is\add* the first step to be accepted \add of him\add*, And wisdom obtaineth his love.
The knowledge of the commandments of the Lord \add is\add* the doctrine of life: And they that do \add things\add* that please him shall receive the fruit of the tree of immortality.
The fear of the Lord \add is\add* all wisdom; And in all wisdom \add is\add* the performance of the law, And the knowledge of his omnipotency.
If a servant say to \add his\add* master, I will not do as it pleaseth \add thee;\add* Though afterward he do \add it\add*, he angereth him that nourisheth him.
The knowledge of wickedness is not wisdom, Neither at any time the counsel of sinners prudence.
There is a wickedness, and the same an abomination; And there is a fool wanting in wisdom.
He that hath small understanding, \add and\add* feareth \add God, is\add* better Than one that hath much wisdom, and transgresseth the law of the most High.
There is an exquisite subtilty, and the same \add is\add* unjust; And there is one that turneth aside to make judgment appear; And there is a wise \add man\add* that justifieth in judgment.
There is a wicked \add man\add* that hangeth down \add his head\add* sadly; But inwardly he \add is\add* full of deceit,
Casting down \add his\add* countenance, and making as if he heard not: Where he is not known, he will do thee a mischief before thou be aware.
And if for want of power he be hindered from sinning, \add Yet\add* when he findeth opportunity he will do evil.
A man may be known by \add his\add* look, And one that hath understanding by \add his\add* countenance, when thou meetest \add him\add*.
A man’s attire, and excessive laughter, And gait, shew what he is.
